text:
NARRATOR: Welcome to
"How to Draw Flik"
FLIK: Not.

NARRATOR: Before we begin,
let's study our reference,
in this case, ants, so cute.

Their anatomy consists of the
head, thorax, and abdomen.
All parts accounted for.
Oops, you forgot my antennae.
NARRATOR: Those are important.

Ants use them for
their sense of smell.

I'm smelling a blueberry
doughnut with sprinkles?

NARRATOR: Don't get
any ideas, Flik.
Aw.

NARRATOR: Anyway, there are
12,000 different types of ants.

Now, that's a party.
I'll take you.
I'll take you.
This is perfect, a party blower.

NARRATOR: Also,
ants have no lungs.

Another fun fact, ants can
lift 20 times their own weight.

Working in teams, ants can
lift all sorts of things.

We sure can, just
like your doughnut?
NARRATOR: Yes, just like my--
wait a minute.
Hey.

I may be biased,
but I feel like you
should let them have this win.
NARRATOR: Fine.

This has been "How
Not to Draw Flik."
Wait.
Save some for me.
